etymology.description: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + phonetic: 昜(昜) (yáng, "sun") = place associated with land "open space" -> field or stage
etymology.interpretation: 场(場) (chǎng, "open space") combines the semantics of 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") with the phonetic indication of 昜(昜) (yáng, "sun") to denote an open area or place, such as a field or stage.
etymology.simplification: 场(場): Simplified by adjusting the phonetic component 昜(昜) visually, preserving the core semantic and phonetic elements.

examples.chinese: 体育场(體育場)上，运动员比赛(運動員比賽)。
露天剧场(露天劇場)中，演员演出(演員演出)。
examples.english: In the open-air theater, actors perform.

examples.chinese: 演唱会场(演唱會場)内，歌迷热情洋溢(歌迷熱情洋溢)。
examples.pinyin: Yǎnchànghuì chǎng nèi, gēmí rèqíng yángyì.
examples.english: Inside the concert venue, fans exude enthusiasm.
